reviews.text: The most common sight at Shippea Hill Station is one of trains not stopping, No services stop weekdays at the station so make sure to check before setting out to use the train from the station

very busy station. gotta make sure to check what platform you want for changing trains because the station is huge and it can take 5-10 minets to walk from one side to another. short walk to the bus transit hub along with metro interchange and taxi ranks 

i think its probs the uks largest station

A quite station if you don't count the road traffic! Shippea Hill's original signal box still stands, but since automatic level crossing gates were installed a few years ago this signal box has remained empty since. None of the less, it makes for a unique trip in the Burnt Fen and for train enthusiasts alike. ( I was not very happy when the 19:27 on Saturday was cancelled though! ) Shippea Hill is an amazing station but a lot of road noise does ruin the stations lovely uniqueness and rural location on which it sits.

Shippea Hill station is on one side an useless station, with only one train a day. It belongs to the least used train station in the world. 
On the other side it is an very interseting and special station. There is nothing near this station. The really only thing you can really do is explore the area on foot. There is no bus connection, so your best bet is walking back to Elly or up north. Or wait for the other train, but that train will arrive 24 hours later.
Very weird place.  The least used station in the UK.  Only one train a day stops here, so you have a long walk to Little Port.  It is even so strange, but it is and fun because it is so weird.
